We are given multiple test cases. For each test case, we have a binary string of even length.
 We want to partition the string into contiguous subsegments of the same character, and we want the length of every segment to be even.
 We can change any character to '0' or '1' at a cost of one operation per change.

 The goal: minimum number of operations.

 Observation:
 We are allowed to change arbitrarily. We note that the problem requires the entire string to be partitioned into contiguous segments of even length, and each segment has the same character.

 However, note that the problem does not require the entire string to be one segment? It can be multiple. But the condition is that the partition must be the minimum number of contiguous subsegments (meaning we break only when adjacent characters are different).

 But note: the problem says "Tokitsukaze divides s into the minimum number of contiguous subsegments, and for each subsegment, all bits in each subsegment are the same." -> This is the natural partition: we break at every change.

 However, we are allowed to change some bits. We want to achieve that in the natural partition (which is the minimum contiguous subsegments) every segment has even length.
